Witchaven villagers are inhabitants of Witchaven. They are discontent with the Fishing Platform being built, as it has taken away their livelihood and the village's source of income.

During the events of The Slug Menace, the sea slugs have begun to possess the villagers, causing them to have yellowish skin and speaking strange things.

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 September –
30 October 2006

The NPCs were renamed from "Witchaven Villager" to "Witchaven villager".

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • They make references to the stars being almost aligned, which is what the Mahjarrat are waiting for.
  • The female villagers wear hats similar to Moonclan hats.
  • The villagers may sing "The Shoals of Herring", a ballad based on the life of Sam Larner, a fisherman and folk singer from Winterton-on-Sea, Norfolk, England.

30 October 2006 |change = The NPCs were renamed from "Witchaven Villager" to "Witchaven villager".}} {{Subject changes footer}} ==Trivia== *They make references to the stars being almost aligned, which is what the [[Mahjarrat]] are waiting for. *The female villagers wear hats similar to [[Moonclan hat]]s. *The villagers may sing "{{Wp|The Shoals of Herring}}", a ballad based on the life of Sam Larner, a fisherman and folk singer from Winterton-on-Sea, Norfolk, England. {{Sea Slug}} {{The Slug Menace}} {{Witchaven}}
